current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To require the Environmental Protection Agency to obtain a court order to garnish wages to pay a
			 nontax debt.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

quote.#text: (1) Except as provided in paragraph (2) and notwithstanding

text.#text: by adding at the end the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may not garnish the disposable
			 pay of any individual without first obtaining a court order.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency

text.#text:
The amount deducted under a court order issued under this paragraph for any pay period may not
			 exceed
			 15 percent of the disposable pay of an individual, except that a greater
			 percentage may be deducted with the written consent of the individual.

If an individual has been reemployed within 1 year after having been involuntarily separated from
			 employment, a court may not order the garnishing of the disposable pay of
			 an individual under this section before the date on which the individual
			 has been reemployed continuously for 1 year.
The amendment made by this section—
shall take effect on the date of enactment of this Act;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, as in effect on the
			 day before the date of enactment of this Act, seeking to garnish the
			 disposable pay of an individual that is pending on the date of enactment
			 of this Act; and
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section
			 3720D of title 31, United States Code

text.#text: shall apply to any action by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Administrator of the Environmental Protection
			 Agency

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, as in
			 effect on the day before the date of enactment of this Act, that is final
			 on the date of enactment of this Act.

text.#text: shall not apply to any garnishment order by the
